Sec. 7-4. - Permit required for tent houses. 
    It shall be unlawful for any person to erect or maintain any tent or tent house in the city limits without a permit from the city manager. 
(Code 1955, § 16-50) 
Sec. 7-5. - Approval required for construction on sites filled with solid waste. 
    The construction of buildings, sewage, or gas or water supply mains, parking lots, or paved areas on or through completed portions of sites filled with solid waste is prohibited unless specifically approved in writing by the City of Jacksonville Public Works Department, Solid Waste Division. 
(Ord. No. 7058, § 1, 6-16-80; Ord. No. 2016-8067, § 1, 2-15-16 ) 
Sec. 7-6. - Insurance requirements for contractors. 
    Any building, electrical, plumbing, gas, mechanical, or other contractor who applies for a building permit under the provisions of this chapter shall be required to provide and maintain at all times, with an insurance company authorized to do business in the State of Florida, the limits of insurance required by any other applicable law or authority having jurisdiction but not less than bodily injury liability insurance with the minimum limits of three hundred thousand dollars ($300,000.00) public liability and fifty thousand dollars ($50,000.00) property damage including any damage to public rights-of-way and shrubbery for Division I general and building contractors and one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000.00) public liability and twenty-five thousand dollars ($25,000.00) property damage including any damage to public rights-of-way and shrubbery for residential contractors and/or Division II contractors, i.e., mechanical, air conditioning, pool contractors, etc. The contractor shall be required to file certificates signed by a qualified agent of the insurer, with the building official showing the type of policy issued, the policy number, the name of the insured, the effective date of the policy, the amount, and providing by endorsement of the policy, an agreement by the insurer to give thirty (30) days' written notice by registered mail to the building official of the intent to cancel the policy for any reason. 
(Ord. No. 7171, § 1, 8-2-82) 
Sec. 7-7. - Reserved. 
Editor's note- Section 7-7, establishing fees for issuance of permits to remove or demolish structures, derived from Ord. No. 7169, § 1, enacted Aug. 2, 1982, was repealed by Ord. No. 7194, § 1, adopted Jan. 3, 1983. 
Sec. 7-8. - Reserved. 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 7473, § 1, adopted Oct. 1, 1990, repealed § 7-8, which pertained to the fee for preparation of energy performance index card and derived from Ord. No. 7170, § 1, Aug. 2, 1982. 
Secs. 7-9-7-15. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE II. - BUILDING CODE[2] 

Footnotes: 
--- (2) --- 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 2002-7821, § 1, adopted Feb. 18, 2002, repealed the former art. II, §§ 7-16-7-18, 7-26-7-30, and enacted a new art. II, §§ 7-16-7-21, as set out herein. The former art. II pertained to similar subject matter and derived from Code 1955, §§ 7-1-7-5, 7-7, as amended. See the Code Comparative Table for complete derivation. 
Cross reference- Code enforcement board, § 2-166 et seq.; sign construction specifications, Ch. 27. 

Sec. 7-16. - Florida Building Code-Adopted. 
    There is hereby adopted by the city for the purpose of establishing rules and regulations for the construction, maintenance, and repair of buildings, including permits and penalties, that certain code known as the Florida Building Code, latest edition. 
(Ord. No. 2002-7821, § 1, 2-18-02) 
Sec. 7-17. - Same-Amended. 
    The building code adopted in section 7-16 is hereby modified, altered, changed and amended by adopting a revised Chapter 1, Administration, which is attached hereto as Exhibit A and made a part hereof. 
    The Florida Building Code, Building is amended by adding a new Section 107.6.1 to the Administration chapter of the Florida Building Code which shall read as follows: 
107.6.1 Building permits issued on the basis of an affidavit. Pursuant to the requirements of federal regulation for participation in the National Flood Insurance Program (44 C.F.R. Sections 59 and 60), the authority granted to the Building Official to issue permits, to rely on inspections, and to accept plans and construction documents on the basis of affidavits and plans submitted pursuant to Section 105.14 and Section 107.6, shall not extend to the flood load and flood resistance construction requirements of the Florida Building Code. 
    The Florida Building Code, Building is amended by adding a new Section 117 to the Administration chapter of the Florida Building Code which shall read as follows: 
117 VARIANCES IN FLOOD HAZARD AREAS 
117.1 Flood hazard areas. Pursuant to section 553.73(5), F.S., the variance procedures adopted in the local floodplain management ordinance shall apply to requests submitted to the Building Official for variances to the provisions of Section 1612.4 of the Florida Building Code, Building or, as applicable, the provisions of R322 of the Florida Building Code, Residential. This section shall not apply to Section 3109 of the Florida Building Code, Building. 
(Ord. No. 2002-7821, § 1, 2-18-02; Ord. No. 2013-8025, §§ 3, 4, 4-1-13) 
Editor's note- Exhibit A, referenced above, is not set out at length herein, but is on file and available for inspection in the city offices. 
Sec. 7-18. - Fire districts. 
    The city shall be and is hereby divided into two (2) areas the boundaries of which are as follows: 
(1)  The first area shall be known as the fire district and shall include all lands located in zoning district I-1. 
(2)  The second area shall embrace all the remaining territory not included in the fire district. 
(3)  Construction in planned unit developments will be governed by location of the development in relation to the fire district and the intended use of the structure or structures. 
(Ord. No. 2002-7821, § 1, 2-18-02) 
Cross reference- Fire prevention and protection, Ch. 10. 
Sec. 7-19. - Payment of fees prerequisite to inspection and approval. 
    No inspection shall be made of any work and no installation shall be approved until all fees due under such permit and any other applicable fees associated with the development have been paid. 
(Ord. No. 2002-7821, § 1, 2-18-02) 
Sec. 7-20. - Fees. 
(a)  Reinspection fees. When extra inspection trips are made necessary by a permit holder due to any of the following reasons, an additional fee shall be charged for each additional inspection: 
(1)  Wrong address given on call for inspection; 
(2)  Work not ready for inspection at time specified; 
(3)  Required corrections not made with time specified; 
(4)  Failure to request required inspections; 
(5)  Additional work done after inspection has been made; 
(6)  When reinspection is necessitated due to a previously failed component and said reinspection is hindered or impossible due to continued construction activity by the permittee; 
(7)  Emergency inspections or requesting of unscheduled inspections. 
(b)  Refund of fees. Where no work has been done under a valid permit for which fees have been paid and a written request for refund of fees is made by the holder thereof within six (6) months of the date of original issuance, the building official may authorize the refund of fifty (50) percent of the building permit fee upon surrender of the permit and cancellation of same. In no event shall any plan check fee be refunded. 
(c)  Schedule of permit fees. The city council, upon recommendation of the city manager, shall by resolution establish the fees for permits issued under this chapter. 
(Ord. No. 2002-7821, § 1, 2-18-02) 
Sec. 7-21. - Persons exempt from paying fees. 
    No fees shall be charged for permits and inspections for construction, repair or alteration of any building work done on any property which is held and used exclusively for religious, scientific, municipal, educational, literary or charitable purposes, and is exempt from the taxation under the constitution and laws of the state whenever there shall be filed with the application for such permit: 
(1)  An affidavit of the owner or its authorized agent naming the organization or association holding such property and the purpose for which such property is used, and making oath that such property is so held and used exclusively by such owner for such purposes; 
(2)  A certificate from the city tax assessor that such property is recognized by him as exempt from taxation because the same is held and used exclusively for such exempting purposes. Upon compliance with this section and all other regulations and ordinances pertaining to such construction, repair, and alteration, such permit shall be marked "exempt" and issued without charge therefor. 
(Ord. No. 2002-7821, § 1, 2-18-02) 
ARTICLE III. - PROPERTY MAINTENANCE CODE[4] 

Footnotes: 
--- (4) --- 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 2002-7821, § 1, adopted Feb. 18, 2002, repealed the former art. III, §§ 7-42-7-46, 7-54-7-59, 7-67-7-80, 7-88-7-91. Section 2 of said ordinance enacted a new art. III, §§ 7-22, 7-23. The former art. III pertained to electrical code and derived from Code 1955, §§ 9-2-9-17; Ord. No. 96-7659, § 1, adopted April 1, 1996; Ord. No. 2000-7786, §§ 1-3, adopted April 3, 2000. 

Sec. 7-22. - International Property Maintenance Code-Adopted. 
    There is hereby adopted by the city for the purpose of establishing minimum standards for occupancy of buildings that certain codes entitled International Property Maintenance Code, latest edition thereof, as published by the International Code Council, Inc. A copy of the subject code has been filed in the office of the city clerk, and the same is hereby adopted and incorporated as if set out at length herein, and from the effective date of this section the provisions contained therein shall be controlling within the limits of the city. 
(Ord. No. 2002-7821, § 2, 2-18-02) 
Sec. 7-23. - Same-Amended. 
(a)  The "Department of Property Maintenance Inspection" referred to in Section 103 is the Planning and Development Department. The term "code official" as used in the Property Maintenance Code shall mean the Director of Planning and Development, or his or her designee. 
(b)  The provisions of the Florida Building Code shall take precedence over any other standard codes referenced in the International Property Maintenance Code. 
(c)  Section 111. Means of Appeal, of the International Property Maintenance Code be and the same is hereby repealed and not adopted. 
(Ord. No. 2002-7821, § 2, 2-18-02) 
Secs. 7-24-7-102. - Reserved.

ARTICLE X. - RESERVED[10] 

Footnotes: 
--- (10) --- 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 2002-7821, § 1, adopted Feb. 18, 2002, repealed art. X, §§ 7-173-7-178, which pertained to coastal construction code and derived from Ord. No. 7338, § 1, adopted Jan. 19, 1987. 

Secs. 7-173-7-178. - Reserved. 
Chapter 8 - CEMETERIES[1] 
Footnotes: 
--- (1) --- 
Cross reference- Streets, sidewalks and other public places, Ch. 28. 

ARTICLE I. - IN GENERAL 

Sec. 8-1. - Lots-Purchase easement form. 
    For the consideration now or hereafter fixed by the city council for the purchase price, upon payment thereof, a conveyance in the form herein specified shall be made and issued to the purchaser of cemetery lots, executed in the name of the city by the mayor and city manager and attested by the city clerk under the seal of the city and duly acknowledged by such officer. 
FORM OF BURIAL EASEMENT 
    Know all men by these present: That pursuant to the Code of Ordinances of Jacksonville Beach, Florida, and in consideration of $ ____________ , the City of Jacksonville Beach, a municipal corporation, hereby grants and conveys to ____________ as Grantee, a Perpetual Easement in the Cemetery Lot herein described, subject to the reservation of the fee in the said City for control of management and improvement and adoption of regulations essential to the uniform, orderly operation of the Cemetery; Section ____________ Block ____________ Lot ____________ Grave No. ____________ as shown on plat prepared by City of Jacksonville Beach Engineering Department and accepted by the City Council of Jacksonville Beach at its regular meeting on April 1, 1957, said plat being filed with the City Clerk of the City of Jacksonville Beach, Florida. 
    TO HAVE AND TO HOLD the same for the burial of grantee and family, deemed herein to be the surviving spouse and lineal descendants of grantee; the surviving spouse being first vested during life with the exercise of easement in control and care of lot, and thence to the lineal descendants; providing the grantee may by will or indenture appoint any person or corporation as executor or personal representative to exercise the right of easement limited or in perpetuity. The rights granted by this easement cannot be sold or assigned except back to the grantor. 
    IN WITNESS WHEREOF the Grantor has caused these presents to be made and executed by its officers, thereunto duly authorized this ____________ day of ____________ / ____________ / ____________ , 19 ____________ . 
Signed, sealed and delivered in our presence CITY OF JACKSONVILLE BEACH (LS) _____By _____
Its Mayor _____By _____
Its City Manager Attest: _____
City Clerk STATE OF FLORIDA COUNTY OF DUVAL I hereby certify that on this day personally came and appeared before me the undersigned officer the following persons _____ , Mayor _____ , City Manager _____ , City Clerk  
of the City of Jacksonville Beach, who being well known to me to be the persons named and such officials, and who did each acknowledge to and before me that as the said officers they did respectively execute and join in the execution of the said deed. 
    Witness my hand and Official Seal this ____________ day of ____________ / ____________ / ____________ , 19 ____________ , at Jacksonville Beach, Duval County, Florida. 
_____
Notary Public State of Florida My commission expires _____  
(Code 1955, § 8-4; Ord. No. 98-7749, § 1, 9-21-98) 
Sec. 8-2. - Same-City clerk to maintain record of grantees, etc. 
    The city clerk shall provide a bound book for the cemetery record, to be kept by the city clerk and each deed delivered under this chapter shall be duly entered, showing the name of grantee, date, the description of the lot, number of grave spaces, date of opening each grave, name of undertaker, and such other data as may complete a record of the operation of the cemetery. In the absence of original deed such record shall be conclusive on any application for burial in any lot in the cemetery. 
(Code 1955, § 8-5; Ord. No. 98-7749, § 1, 9-21-98) 
Sec. 8-3. - Disinterments; molesting graves. 
    All applications for opening any grave shall be made in such form as may be provided and prescribed by the city manager and such applications shall be checked for lot described in cemetery record book by the city clerk and endorsed on such applications, and it shall be the duty of the city manager to cause the lot to be located on the ground as corresponding to the records, and the city manager is hereby authorized to adopt such reasonable uniform regulations as deemed essential for the protection, improvement and orderly operation of the cemeteries and file the same in the office of the city clerk, and it shall be unlawful for any person to open any grave, bury any body, or disinter any remains in the city cemeteries without a permit issued by the city-or commit any act of vandalism, willfully molest any grave, plat or markers thereof, or injure or appropriate any trees or growth, equipment or property therein and any person who shall violate this provision shall be guilty of a misdemeanor. 
(Code 1955, § 8-6; Ord. No. 98-7749, § 1, 9-21-98) 
Secs. 8-4-8-15. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE II. - RESERVED[2]
